newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek shares extend rebound, approach 1,700pts.
newsitem.headline: Greek shares extend rebound, approach 1,700pts.

text.p: Easing selling pressure in large private banks and momentum carried over from Monday's session helped Greek shares extend their rebound from the 1,600 level in early Tuesday trade.
The broader market was being pulled higher by Alpha Credit Bank and ErgoBank which were recovering from heavy selling pressure in the past couple of sessions.
Brokers said the market was bouncing back after a sizeable correction due to institutional selling.

"The market completed its 150-point correction down to 1,600 which was largely the result of profit-taking by large domestic and mostly foreign portfolios," said Costas Feggos, managing director of Axon Securities.
The French election outcome and last week's interbank rate hike mostly unnerved institutional investors but they did not wrap up their positions.
"They merely rebalanced their portfolios realising their large capital gains and purchased stock at lower price levels," he added.
Technical analysts pointed out the validity of the 1,600 support level.
"The support level at 1,600 points corresponds to a 33 percent correction of the rally from 1,440 to 1,750 points," said Commercial Securities in its technical analysis outlook.
Following Tuesday's performance, the market was expected to enter a trading range at higher levels.
"Prices will consolidate in a trading range with 1,650 points being its floor level," Feggos said.
"The index will most likely move towards the broader 1,700 level where prices will consolidate unless volume picks up," said Commercial Securities which also warranted caution.
"The market has entered a phase of increased short-term volatility with no clear direction," it said.
The Athens general index was up 2.45 percent or 40.53 points at 1,693.52 from Monday's 1,652.99 close after 25 minutes of trading.
It opened at 1,673.00 points and continued to move higher throughout the early stages of trade, reaching an intra-day high of 1,697.52.
Advancers led decliners 119 to 35 with 22 shares unchanged on 176 traded.
The Merrill Lynch call spread warrant on OTE with a strike price of 3,800 drachmas was quoted at 1,121-1,151. Shares of OTE telecom, the underlying, were up 200 drachmas at 7,600 drachmas.
The Merrill Lynch American call warrant on a basket of 23 Greek equities that are part of the Athens general index was quoted at 714.95-760.59. The warrants expire January 9 1998.

The ING Baring Financial Products American style call warrant based on a basket of six bank stocks was quoted at $88.39-$90.08. The strike price is set at $99.60 and the warrants expire October 8, 1997.

The ING Baring Financial Products American-style call warrant on a basket of six blue-chips denominated in drachmas was quoted at 4,447-4,685 drachmas. The strike price is set at 10,000 drachmas and the warrants expire on February 2, 1998.
The ING Baring American-style second call warrant on a basket of six bank stocks was quoted at $19.24-N/O. The strike price is set at $110.0 and the warrants expire April 9 1998.

The recently launched ING Baring American-style, drachma- denominated call warrant on the bourse's benchmark index was quoted at 304-338 drachmas. The strike price is set at 1,639 points and the warrants expire May 14 1998.
